description:
Calculate the inverse of a quaternion. For a unit quaternion, its inverse is the same as its
    {@link Quat(0).conjugate|Quat.conjugate}.
name: inverse

params.description: The quaternion.
params.name: q

returns.description: The inverse of q.

examples:
<caption>A quaternion multiplied by its inverse is a zero rotation.</caption>
var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(10, 20, 30);
Quat.print("quaternion", quaternion, true); // dvec3(10.000000, 20.000004, 30.000004)
var inverse = Quat.invserse(quaternion);
Quat.print("inverse", inverse, true); // dvec3(1.116056, -22.242186, -28.451778)
var identity = Quat.multiply(inverse, quaternion);
Quat.print("identity", identity, true); // dvec3(0.000000, 0.000000, 0.000000)

description:
Get the "front" direction that the camera would face if its orientation was set to the quaternion value.
This is a synonym for {@link Quat(0).getForward|Quat.getForward}.
The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getFront

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: The negative z-axis rotated by orientation.

description:
Get the "forward" direction that the camera would face if its orientation was set to the quaternion value.
This is a synonym for {@link Quat(0).getFront|Quat.getFront}.
The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getForward

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: The negative z-axis rotated by orientation.

examples:
<caption>Demonstrate that the "forward" vector is for the negative z-axis.</caption>
var forward = Quat.getForward(Quat.IDENTITY);
print(JSON.stringify(forward)); // {"x":0,"y":0,"z":-1}

description:
Get the "right" direction that the camera would have if its orientation was set to the quaternion value.
The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getRight

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: The x-axis rotated by orientation.

description:
Get the "up" direction that the camera would have if its orientation was set to the quaternion value.
The High Fidelity camera has axes x = right, y = up, -z = forward.
name: getUp

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: The y-axis rotated by orientation.

description:
Calculate the Euler angles for the quaternion, in degrees. (The "safe" in the name signifies that the angle results will
not be garbage even when the rotation is particularly difficult to decompose with pitches around +/-90 degrees.)
name: safeEulerAngles

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: A {@link Vec3} of Euler angles for the orientation, in degrees, the angles being the rotations about the x, y, and z axes.

examples:
<caption>Report the camera yaw.</caption>
var eulerAngles = Quat.safeEulerAngles(Camera.orientation);
print("Camera yaw: " + eulerAngles.y);

description: Generate a quaternion given an angle to rotate through and an axis to rotate about.
name: angleAxis

params.description: The angle to rotate through, in degrees.
params.name: angle

params.description: The unit axis to rotate about.
params.name: axis

returns.description: A quaternion that is a rotation through angle degrees about the axis. WARNING: This value is in degrees whereas the value returned by {@link Quat(0).angle|Quat.angle} is in radians.

examples:
<caption>Calculate a rotation of 90 degrees about the direction your camera is looking.</caption>
var rotation = Quat.angleAxis(90, Quat.getForward(Camera.orientation));

description: Get the rotation axis for a quaternion.
name: axis

params.description: The quaternion.
params.name: q

returns.description: The normalized rotation axis for q.

examples:
<caption>Get the rotation axis of a quaternion.</caption>
var forward = Quat.getForward(Camera.orientation);
var rotation = Quat.angleAxis(90, forward);
var axis = Quat.axis(rotation);
print("Forward: " + JSON.stringify(forward));
print("Axis: " + JSON.stringify(axis)); // Same value as forward.

description: Get the rotation angle for a quaternion.
name: angle

params.description: The quaternion.
params.name: q

returns.description: The rotation angle for q, in radians. WARNING: This value is in radians whereas the value used by {@link Quat(0).angleAxis|Quat.angleAxis} is in degrees.

examples:
<caption>Get the rotation angle of a quaternion.</caption>
var forward = Quat.getForward(Camera.orientation);
var rotation = Quat.angleAxis(90, forward);
var angle = Quat.angle(rotation);
print("Angle: " + angle * 180 / Math.PI);  // 90 degrees.

description:
Compute a spherical linear interpolation between two rotations, safely handling two rotations that are very similar.
See also, {@link Quat(0).slerp|Quat.slerp}.
name: mix

params.description: The beginning rotation.
params.name: q1

params.description: The ending rotation.
params.name: q2

params.description: The mixture coefficient between 0.0 and 1.0. Specifies the proportion of q2's value to return in favor of q1's value. A value of 0.0 returns q1's value; 1.0 returns q2s's value.
params.name: alpha

returns.description: A spherical linear interpolation between rotations q1 and q2.

examples:
<caption>Animate between one rotation and another.</caption>
var dt = amountOfTimeThatHasPassed;
var mixFactor = amountOfTimeThatHasPassed / TIME_TO_COMPLETE;
if (mixFactor > 1) {
    mixFactor = 1;
}
var newRotation = Quat.mix(startRotation, endRotation, mixFactor);

description:
Compute a spherical linear interpolation between two rotations, for rotations that are not very similar.
See also, {@link Quat(0).mix|Quat.mix}.
name: slerp

params.description: The beginning rotation.
params.name: q1

params.description: The ending rotation.
params.name: q2

params.description: The mixture coefficient between 0.0 and 1.0. Specifies the proportion of q2's value to return in favor of q1's value. A value of 0.0 returns q1's value; 1.0 returns q2s's value.
params.name: alpha

returns.description: A spherical linear interpolation between rotations q1 and q2.

description: Compute a spherical quadrangle interpolation between two rotations along a path oriented toward two other rotations. Equivalent to: Quat.slerp(Quat.slerp(q1, q2, alpha), Quat.slerp(s1, s2, alpha), 2 * alpha * (1.0 - alpha)).
name: squad

params.description: Initial rotation.
params.name: q1

params.description: Final rotation.
params.name: q2

params.description: First control point.
params.name: s1

params.description: Second control point.
params.name: s2

params.description: The mixture coefficient between 0.0 and 1.0. A value of 0.0 returns q1's value; 1.0 returns q2s's value.
params.name: alpha

returns.description: A spherical quadrangle interpolation between rotations q1 and q2 using control points s1 and s2.

description:
Calculate the dot product of two quaternions. The closer the quaternions are to each other the more non-zero the value is
(either positive or negative). Identical unit rotations have a dot product of +/- 1.
name: dot

params.description: The first quaternion.
params.name: q1

params.description: The second quaternion.
params.name: q2

returns.description: The dot product of q1 and q2.

examples:
<caption>Testing unit quaternions for equality.</caption>
var q1 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 0);
var q2 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 0);
print(Quat.equal(q1, q2)); // true
var q3 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 359.95);
print(Quat.equal(q1, q3)); // false

var dot = Quat.dot(q1, q3);
print(dot); // -0.9999999403953552
var equal = Math.abs(1 - Math.abs(dot)) < 0.000001;
print(equal); // true

description: Print to the program log a text label followed by a quaternion's pitch, yaw, and roll Euler angles.
name: print

params.description: The label to print.
params.name: label

params.description: The quaternion to print.
params.name: q

params.description: If true the angle values are printed in degrees, otherwise they are printed in radians.
params.name: asDegrees

examples:
<caption>Two ways of printing a label plus a quaternion's Euler angles.</caption>
var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 45, 0);

// Quaternion: dvec3(0.000000, 45.000004, 0.000000)
Quat.print("Quaternion:", quaternion,  true);

// Quaternion: {"x":0,"y":45.000003814697266,"z":0}
print("Quaternion: " + JSON.stringify(Quat.safeEulerAngles(quaternion)));

description: Test whether two quaternions are equal. Note: The quaternions must be exactly equal in order for true to be returned; it is often better to use {@link Quat(0).dot|Quat.dot} and test for closeness to +/-1.
name: equal

params.description: The first quaternion.
params.name: q1

params.description: The second quaternion.
params.name: q2

returns.description: true if the quaternions are equal, otherwise false.

examples:
<caption>Testing unit quaternions for equality.</caption>
var q1 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 0);
var q2 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 0);
print(Quat.equal(q1, q2)); // true
var q3 = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(0, 0, 359.95);
print(Quat.equal(q1, q3)); // false

var dot = Quat.dot(q1, q3);
print(dot); // -0.9999999403953552
var equal = Math.abs(1 - Math.abs(dot)) < 0.000001;
print(equal); // true

description:
Cancels out the roll and pitch component of a quaternion so that its completely horizontal with a yaw pointing in the 
given quaternion's direction.
name: cancelOutRollAndPitch

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: orientation with its roll and pitch canceled out.

examples:
<caption>Two ways of calculating a camera orientation in the x-z plane with a yaw pointing in the direction of
    a given quaternion.</caption>
var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(10, 20, 30);

var noRollOrPitch = Quat.cancelOutRollAndPitch(quaternion);
Quat.print("", noRollOrPitch, true); // dvec3(0.000000, 22.245995, 0.000000)

var front = Quat.getFront(quaternion);
var lookAt = Quat.lookAtSimple(Vec3.ZERO, { x: front.x, y: 0, z: front.z });
Quat.print("", lookAt, true); // dvec3(0.000000, 22.245996, 0.000000)

description: Cancels out the roll component of a quaternion so that its horizontal axis is level.
name: cancelOutRoll

params.description: A quaternion representing an orientation.
params.name: orientation

returns.description: orientation with its roll canceled out.

examples:
<caption>Two ways of calculating a camera orientation that points in the direction of a given quaternion but
    keeps the camera's horizontal axis level.</caption>
var quaternion = Quat.fromPitchYawRollDegrees(10, 20, 30);

var noRoll = Quat.cancelOutRoll(quaternion);
Quat.print("", noRoll, true); // dvec3(-1.033004, 22.245996, -0.000000)

var front = Quat.getFront(quaternion);
var lookAt = Quat.lookAtSimple(Vec3.ZERO, front);
Quat.print("", lookAt, true); // dvec3(-1.033004, 22.245996, -0.000000)

description: A UUID (Universally Unique IDentifier) is used to uniquely identify entities, overlays, avatars, and the like. It is represented in JavaScript as a string in the format, {nnnnnnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnnnnnnnnnn}, where the "n"s are hexadecimal digits.
name: Uuid

description: Generates a UUID from a string representation of the UUID.
name: fromString

params.description: A string representation of a UUID. The curly braces are optional.
params.name: string

returns.description: A UUID if the given string is valid, null otherwise.

examples:
<caption>Valid and invalid parameters.</caption>
var uuid = Uuid.fromString("{527c27ea-6d7b-4b47-9ae2-b3051d50d2cd}");
print(uuid); // {527c27ea-6d7b-4b47-9ae2-b3051d50d2cd}

uuid = Uuid.fromString("527c27ea-6d7b-4b47-9ae2-b3051d50d2cd");
print(uuid); // {527c27ea-6d7b-4b47-9ae2-b3051d50d2cd}

uuid = Uuid.fromString("527c27ea");
print(uuid); // null

description:
Generates a string representation of a UUID. However, because UUIDs are represented in JavaScript as strings, this is in
effect a no-op.
name: toString

params.description: The UUID to generate a string from.
params.name: id

returns.description: - A string representation of the UUID.

description: Generate a new UUID.
name: generate

returns.description: A new UUID.

examples:
<caption>Generate a new UUID and reports its JavaScript type.</caption>
var uuid = Uuid.generate();
print(uuid);        // {nnnnnnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnnnnnnnnnn}
print(typeof uuid); // string

description: Test whether two given UUIDs are equal.
name: isEqual

params.description: The first UUID to compare.
params.name: idA

params.description: The second UUID to compare.
params.name: idB

returns.description: true if the two UUIDs are equal, otherwise false.

examples: Demonstrate true and false cases. var uuidA = Uuid.generate(); var uuidB = Uuid.generate(); print(Uuid.isEqual(uuidA, uuidB)); // false uuidB = uuidA; print(Uuid.isEqual(uuidA, uuidB)); // true

description: Test whether a given UUID is null.
name: isNull

params.description: The UUID to test.
params.name: id

returns.description: true if the UUID equals Uuid.NULL or is null, otherwise false.

examples: Demonstrate true and false cases. var uuid; // undefined print(Uuid.isNull(uuid)); // false uuid = Uuid.generate(); print(Uuid.isNull(uuid)); // false uuid = Uuid.NULL; print(Uuid.isNull(uuid)); // true uuid = null; print(Uuid.isNull(uuid)); // true

description: Print to the program log a text label followed by the UUID value.
name: print

params.description: The label to print.
params.name: label

params.description: The UUID to print.
params.name: id

examples:
<caption>Two ways of printing a label plus UUID.</caption>

Uuid.print("Generated UUID:", uuid); // Generated UUID: {nnnnnnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnnnnnnnnnn}
print("Generated UUID: " + uuid);    // Generated UUID: {nnnnnnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnn-nnnnnnnnnnnn}

description: Ignore another user.
name: ignore

params.description: The node or session ID of the user you want to ignore.
params.name: nodeID

params.description: True for ignored; false for un-ignored.
params.name: enable

description: Gets a bool containing whether you have ignored the given Avatar UUID.
name: getIgnoreStatus

params.description: The node or session ID of the user whose ignore status you want.
params.name: nodeID

description: Mute another user for you and you only.
name: personalMute

params.description: The node or session ID of the user you want to mute.
params.name: nodeID

params.description: True for enabled; false for disabled.
params.name: enable

description: Requests a bool containing whether you have personally muted the given Avatar UUID.
name: requestPersonalMuteStatus

params.description: The node or session ID of the user whose personal mute status you want.
params.name: nodeID

description:
Sets an avatar's gain for you and you only.
Units are Decibels (dB)
name: setAvatarGain

params.description: The node or session ID of the user whose gain you want to modify, or null to set the master gain.
params.name: nodeID

params.description: The gain of the avatar you'd like to set. Units are dB.
params.name: gain

description: Gets an avatar's gain for you and you only.
name: getAvatarGain

params.description: The node or session ID of the user whose gain you want to get, or null to get the master gain.
params.name: nodeID

returns.description: gain (in dB)

description: Kick another user.
name: kick

params.description: The node or session ID of the user you want to kick.
params.name: nodeID

description: Mute another user for everyone.
name: mute

params.description: The node or session ID of the user you want to mute.
params.name: nodeID

description: Returns a string containing the username associated with the given Avatar UUID
name: getUsernameFromID

params.description: The node or session ID of the user whose username you want.
params.name: nodeID

description: Returns `true` if the DomainServer will allow this Node/Avatar to make kick
name: getCanKick

returns.description: `true` if the client can kick other users, `false` if not.

description: Toggle the state of the ignore in radius feature
name: toggleIgnoreRadius

description: Enables the ignore radius feature.
name: enableIgnoreRadius

description: Disables the ignore radius feature.
name: disableIgnoreRadius

description: Returns `true` if the ignore in radius feature is enabled
name: getIgnoreRadiusEnabled

returns.description: `true` if the ignore in radius feature is enabled, `false` if not.

description: Notifies scripts that another user has entered the ignore radius
name: enteredIgnoreRadius

description:
Notifies scripts of the username and machine fingerprint associated with a UUID.
Username and machineFingerprint will be their default constructor output if the requesting user isn't an admin.
name: usernameFromIDReply

description: Notifies scripts that a user has disconnected from the domain
name: avatarDisconnected

params.description: The session ID of the avatar that has disconnected
params.name: NodeID
